context_bundle.summary: TypeScript configuration best practices with tsconfig.json, strict mode settings, advanced type features, and compilation strategies for type-safe JavaScript development

onboarding.quick_start: npm install -D typescript @types/node && npx tsc --init --strict && npx tsc --watch
common_patterns: Type inference: 'const user = { name: "Alice", age: 30 }; // TypeScript infers { name: string; age: number }'
Union types: 'type Status = "pending" | "success" | "error"; function handle(status: Status) {}'
Generics: 'function identity<T>(value: T): T { return value; } const num = identity(42); // T inferred as number'
Type guards: 'function isString(value: unknown): value is string { return typeof value === "string"; }'
Utility types: 'type Partial<T> = { [P in keyof T]?: T[P] }; type ReadonlyUser = Readonly<User>;'
Declaration files: 'declare module "my-module" { export function doSomething(): void; }' in .d.ts file
known_errors: Cannot find module: Install types with 'npm install -D @types/package-name', check tsconfig paths
Type 'X' is not assignable to type 'Y': Check type compatibility, use type assertion 'as Type' or type guard
Object is possibly 'undefined': Use optional chaining 'obj?.prop' or nullish coalescing 'obj ?? default'
Circular dependency: Refactor to break cycle, use interfaces for type-only imports
Module resolution error: Set 'moduleResolution: "NodeNext"' in tsconfig for Node.js 16+
Declaration emit error: Check for type errors in exported functions, use 'skipLibCheck: true' temporarily
